review_title: Pathetically Low Pay Relative to Hours
pros: Laid back environment for the most part.
cons: Working 80+ hours per week during peak season, pay comes out to less than 7 dollars per hour for summer interns. Beware.

review_title: Super fun fast paced place to work.

cons: None, coworkers are amazing and everyone works as a team. Managers take care of their employees.

review_title: Perfect Opportunity to Grow Your Event Management Skills
job_title: Event Management & Sports Administration in Blaine, MN
pros:
Fast-paced environment
Friendly coworkers who are willing to help
Great team to work around
Excellent networking opportunities
Rewarding to see the work you put in for all the athletes and spectators
cons: It is an excellent place for an internship as long as you are ready to put in the hours

pros: Very supportive, great group of people, family friendly

review_title: Great Learning opportunity for entry level sports managers.
pros: Great way to get your feet wet in the business of sports.  A lot of opportunity to learn on the fly with other peers who are in the same boat.  Great way to network with a large consumer base.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement inside the company.   May be a ceiling on what you can learn from the organization.

pros: Good relaxed atmosphere, fun work environment, always events going on so it keeps you active, you get to drive around in a gold cart
cons: A lot of the times you have to work weekends and also close some nights, not much growth potential in the NSC
